revised_title: Anatomy and Habitat of the Dugong
tldr: The author provides a detailed description of the dugong's anatomy, habitat, and behavior. They note that the dugong resembles common cetaceans but lacks dorsal and ventral fins. The animal has a thick skin, a small head with two tusks, and a diet consisting of marine vegetation. The dugong is found in shallow waters and inlets, with the highest numbers caught during the northerly monsoon near the mouth of the Johore river.
